oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Firettes at Engine Company 8, Nashville, Tennessee, 1965 July
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A group photo of the championship baton twirlers known as the “Firettes,” posing at Metro Nashville Fire Department Engine Company No. 8, circa July, 1965. The Firettes won the World Baton Twirling Championship of 1964. Baton twirling is a physically demanding and highly creative sport that combines dance and gymnastic routines set to music with batons twirling and flying through the air. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 filmstrip negative, b & w.
